resources.name: 1-agentSbomWsGuid
resources.description:
1. use this command to return a list of GUIDs for all of your defined agent SCA Workspaces.
  2. select the value for the id field of the Workspace which contains the Project for which you want to generate an SBOM.
  3. copy this value to your clipboard.
  4. click on 2-agentSbomProjGuid and send that GET statement.

resources.name: 2-agentSbomProjGuid
resources.description:
1. Prior to sending this GET, you must have already sent the request in 1-agentSbomWsGuid (on the left) and obtained the Worksspace ID
  2. Paste that Workspace ID into this GET command (above) which should then have the following format:

    https://api.veracode.com/srcclr/v3/workspaces/{workspaceId}/projects?type=agent"

  3. Locate the Project containing the results for which you want to generate an SBOM for and copy the GUID value into your clipboard
  4. Click on 3-agentSbomCreate to the left

resources.name: 3-agentSbomCreate
resources.description:
1. Prior to sending this GET, you must have already sent the request in 2-agentSbomProjGuid (on the left) and obtained the Project ID
  2. Paste that Project ID into this GET command (above) which should then have the following format:

    https://api.veracode.com/srcclr/sbom/v1/targets/{projectGuid}/cyclonedx?type=agent

  3. Send this GET statement and an SBOM in CycloneDx format will be returned

resources.name: 1-collectionsGetAppGUID
resources.description:
Use this command to return a list of all of your defined App Profiles.
  1. From the returned output, select the GUID for the Business Unit to which the Collection will belong and paste it into any text editor or spreadsheet app
  2. From the returned output, select the GUID for the Application to be included in the Collection and paste it into any text editor or spreadsheet
  3. repeat step 2 until you've added all of the applications that will be contained within the Collection These values will be needed to create the json file used as input in the next step -

    2-collectionsCreatCollection

resources.name: 2-collectionsCreateCollection
